Package controller

Class DatabaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.DatabaseController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BookingController, CineplexController, MovieController, MovieGoerController, MovieScreeningController, StaffController

    public abstract class DatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    A controller to perform storing and retrieval of model to/from database.
    Since:
    2017-11-06
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wong Jing Lun

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseController

        public DatabaseController​()
        Creates a new Database Controller. Also initialize the buffer data list for retrieval.

    • Method Detail

      • readDB

        protected abstract void readDB​()
        Method to allow specialized controllers to handle the structure of the model file during model retrieval

      • writeDB

        protected abstract void writeDB​()
        Method to allow specialized controllers to handle the structure of model file during model storing

      • checkDirectoryExist

        public boolean checkDirectoryExist​(java.lang.String dirPath)
        Check if the directory in database exists. Create the directory if it does not exists.
        Parameters:
        dirPath - Directory path of the database
        Returns:
        True if it the directory exists or created successfully. False otherwise.

      • getListofFiles

        public java.io.File[] getListofFiles​(java.lang.String folderName)
        Gets the list of files in the database directory. It will excludes the files with special properties such as those starting with a dot.
        Parameters:
        folderName - Name of the directory path containing the files.
        Returns:
        List of files in the directory.

      • saveData

        public void saveData​(java.lang.String fileName,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> dat)
        Store a specified model into database
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the model file to store model
        dat - Data to store into the database

      • retrieveData

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> retrieveData​(java.lang.String fileName)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve a specified model from database
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the model file
        Returns:
        Retrieved model in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - File do not exists
